p: This family is also known as the holly family. The holly genus Ilex comprises more than 400 species worldwide. The majority of species grow in mountainous areas of the tropics, mainly South-Central America and Asia. Generally, the family included shrubs or trees, most of which are evergreen. The leaves of the well-known I. paraguariensis are used in South America to prepare the well-known tea called yerba mate. The most representative species in Europe is the European holly ( I. aquifollium), widely used for decoration.
